Package edu.lehigh.cse.lol

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CollisionCallback
    A callback to run when a WorldActor collides with another WorldActor
    LolActorEvent
    LolActorEvent describes code to run in response to an event, when the only information needed to handle the event is the specific WorldActor who was involved in the event.
    ScreenManager
    The ScreenManager interface provides a way for programmers to tell LibLOL how to configure a screen.
    TextProducer
    TextProducer is a way to tell a game to run code in order to generate some text.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Animation
    Animation is a way of describing a set of images that can be used to do flip-book animation on any actor.
    BaseActor
    BaseActor is the parent of all Actor types.
    Config
    Config stores game-specific configuration values.
    Destination
    Destinations are actors that the Hero should try to reach.
    Effect
    Effects provide a way of describing visual artifacts on the screen that do not have a physics aspect.
    Enemy
    Enemies are things to be avoided or defeated by the Hero.
    Goodie
    Goodies are actors that a hero can collect.
    Hero
    The Hero is the focal point of a game.
    HudScene
    Hud is a heads-up display.
    Level
    Level provides a broad, public, declarative interface to the core functionality of LibLOL.
    Lol
    The Lol object is the outermost container for all of the functionality of the game.
    LolAction
    LolAction describes code that runs in response to events.
    Obstacle
    Obstacles are usually walls, except they can move, and can be used to run all sorts of arbitrary code that changes the game, or the behavior of the things that collide with them.
    PanEventHandler
    PanEventHandler is a wrapper for code that ought to run in response to a pan event.
    QuickScene  
    Route
    A Route specifies a set of points that an actor will move between at a fixed speed.
    SceneActor
    SceneActor is any actor that can be put onto a QuickScene or the Hud.
    Svg
    The Svg infrastructure allows the game designer to load SVG line drawings into a game.
    ToggleEventHandler
    ToggleEventHandler is a wrapper for code that ought to run in response to a toggle event.
    TouchEventHandler
    TouchEventHandler is a wrapper for code that ought to run in response to a touch event.
    WorldActor
    WorldActor is the base class upon which every actor in the main game is built.
